required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of an Online Meditation Course on Quality of Life
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of an Online Meditation Course on Quality of Life and Positive Emotions - a Prospective Observational Study (EXPAN Study)

brief_summary.textblock: Many interventions in the field of meditation are becoming increasingly popular and have gained worldwide acceptance over the past years, both in terms of health, but also psychological aspects. On the other hand, controversial and sometimes hypercritical positions are on the rise, questioning the positive effects of meditation on health due to the limited availability of high-quality scientific data. With regard to a large number of meditation interventions, the systematic exploration of procedures that have not yet been scientifically evaluated - also in online settings - is a meaningful contribution to meditation research.

primary_outcome.measure: Quality of life, PROMIS-29 Profile v2.1
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Quality of life at 1 months
primary_outcome.description: The scale ranges from 0 to 100, where 0 is the lowest level and 100 is the highest level.

Assessed retrospectively (last 1 month) with self-designed question

intervention.description: An online survey will be offered to participants who have enrolled in a 21-day meditation online course. The survey will be conducted using mobile website technology before and after the online course and additionally after 3 and 6 months.

study_pop.textblock: - All persons registering for the online course

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Age: 18 years or older
- All persons registering for the online course
- Internet access
- Sufficient language skills, as well as cognitive and physical abilities, to participate in an online survey lasting approximately 30 minutes
- Active consent to the online consent form
Exclusion criteria
- Failure to provide informed consent to participate in the study
